page.title: 14REDHILL FARM,SELSLEY COMMON
page.content: The dairy and beef farm has 150 acres. The major change in the last 20 years has been the replacement of people by machinery, more stock, spraying, the use of fertilisers and the loss of Elm trees because of Dutch Elm Disease. The farm has Hereford Cross Cattle for beef and British Friesians which produce approx.700l of milk a day. {A DAY IN SUMMER}: GET UP AT 6.30 A.M. DO MILKING;CHECK THE CATTLE; HAYMAKING OR SILAGING; MILKING; MORE HAYMAKING OR SILAGING. {A DAY IN WINTER}: GET UP AT 6.30 A.M. DO MILKING; BED THE COWS WITH STRAW; SCRAPE THE YARDS; FEED THE COWS; MILKING AGAIN. Mr.Merrett has 16 fields. There are 160 cows.He has Common Rights on Selsley Common and on a nearby meadow.
